channel.title: Hi again

item.title: Hi again
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

Where did your tag go?

Keep declaration consistent, either define type or don’t.

<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style.css"> <link rel="stylesheet" href="css/font-awesome/css/font-awesome.min.css" />

Conventions pls.

You could try to ‘liven’ up your text boxes (much blue & white), perhaps match the navigation bar theme (opaque black). A nice background colour or pattern would also be great, I would recommend a blue one.

I also think some of your naming could be better, ie #footerleft -> footer #left, just personal opinion though.

Read full topic

item.title: Hi again
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:5, topic:540934”]- Give the large boxes a padding of 10 or 20 pixels and it’ll make it 100x better

  • Alt text on images is necessary
  • If every item in the list has a class of ‘navtext’ just give the ul a class of navtext and then use the stylesheet to style the individual items, like so:
    ul.navtext li { }[/quote]
    Alright, thanks for the advice.

[quote=“Ruby, post:6, topic:540934”]Justify the text, it makes it look much nicer and neater in a box like that. Alongside that try and not leave a clash like the dark/light one you have, the code errors have been picked up but this hasn’t. Try keeping the theme either light or dark, not both, try a light grey noisy background on it or something, see how that looks but don’t just leave it white.

Getting there my little indian. Soon.[/quote]
Sure, I’ll try it out.
PS - I’m still not Indian. Maybe some day.

Read full topic

item.title: Hi again
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Justify the text, it makes it look much nicer and neater in a box like that. Alongside that try and not leave a clash like the dark/light one you have, the code errors have been picked up but this hasn’t. Try keeping the theme either light or dark, not both, try a light grey noisy background on it or something, see how that looks but don’t just leave it white.

Getting there my little indian. Soon.

Read full topic

item.title: Hi again
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

  • Give the large boxes a padding of 10 or 20 pixels and it’ll make it 100x better
  • Alt text on images is necessary
  • If every item in the list has a class of ‘navtext’ just give the ul a class of navtext and then use the stylesheet to style the individual items, like so:
    ul.navtext li { }

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

buzenr:

What’s the big white space under the footer of the website?

Just white space in the background of the imgur page, nothing to do with the site itself.

item.title: Hi again
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

It’s been a while.
[hr]
I’ve been studying some website design with the help of RevengePK and I’m pretty happy to say that I’ve actually gotten somewhere. It might be a very simply page but I’m still learning.

http://i.imgur.com/LQpCfef.png
http://i.imgur.com/udqCV1E.png

[code=html5]

<head>
    <meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=utf-8" />
    <link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="style.css">
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="css/font-awesome/css/font-awesome.min.css" />
    <title>john for website designer</title>
</head>

<body>
    <nav>
        <div id="leftnav">  <span class="logo"> <i class="fa fa-music"></i> <span id="logotext"><a href="index.html">SoundWave</a></span>
        </div>
        <ul>
            <li class="navtext"><a href="#">Home</a>

            </li>
            <li class="navtext"><a href="#">Home</a>

            </li>
            <li class="navtext"><a href="portfolio.html">Portfolio</a>

            </li>
            <li class="navtext"><a href="index.html">Home</a>

            </li>
        </ul>
    </nav>
    <div id="bigpicture">
        <img src="soundwave.jpg"></img>
    </div>
    <div id="infowrapper">
        <div class="sidebar">
            <div class="header">INFORMATION:</div>
            <div class="info"> <i class="fa fa-phone-square rotate"></i> Phone: (###)-###-####
                <br /> <i class="fa fa-envelope-o rotate"></i> Mail: person@mail.com
                <br /> <i class="fa fa-home rotate"></i> Address: 123 Random Street</div>
            <hr />
            <div class="info"> <i class="fa fa-male rotate"></i> Name: ____ ____
                <br /> <i class="fa fa-book rotate"></i> School: ________
                <br /> <i class="fa fa-cog rotate"></i> Job: _________</div>
        </div>
        <div id="announcewrapper">
            <div class="announcement">
                <div class="header">Announcement:</div>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. [/code] [code=css] html { width: 100%; } body { background-color: #FFF; width: 100%; margin: 0 0 0 0; } img { max-width: 100%; max-height: 450px; min-height: 300px; width: 100%; } a { color: #FFF; text-decoration:none; } a:hover { color: #009ACD; text-decoration:none; } ul { list-style-type:none; margin: 0 0 0 0; } li { display:inline; padding: 0 5px 0 5px; } nav { background-color: black; width: 100%; height: 50px; border: 3px black solid; padding: 3px; margin: 0 auto 0 -.72%; opacity: 0.6; filter: alpha(opacity=60); /* For IE8 and earlier */ position: fixed; font-family:"Franklin Gothic Book"; text-decoration: none; } #leftnav { width: 250px; float: left; } #logotext:hover { color: #009ACD; line-height: 190%; font-size: 25px; font-style: normal; font-weight: bold; } .logo { color: #FFF; line-height: 200%; font-size: 25px; font-style: normal; text-decoration:none; margin-left: 55px; } .navtext { line-height: 260%; font-size: 18px; color: #FFF; float: right; margin-right: 100px; text-decoration:none; } #bigpicture { width: 100%; height: 450px; margin: -8px 0 0 0; } #infowrapper { overflow: hidden; } #announcewrapper { width: 60%; overflow: hidden; } .announcement { float: left; width: 600px; height: auto; border: 1px #009ACD solid; border-radius: 9px; padding: 3.3px; margin: 35px 0 0 50px; font-family:"Roboto"; font-size: 15px; overflow: hidden; } .header { width: 101%; height: 30px; border: 1px #009ACD solid; padding: 0; margin: -4px 0 0 -3.5px; background-color: #009ACD; text-align: center; line-height: 180%; font-size: 20px; color: #FFF; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; } .sidebar { float: right; width: 348px; height: 315px; border: 1px #009ACD solid; border-radius: 9px; padding: 1px; margin: 35px 100px 0 0; font-family:"Roboto"; font-size: 15px; overflow: hidden; } footer { width: 100%; height: 50px; bottom: 50px; background-color: #000; margin: 50px 0 0 0; } #footerleft { line-height: 260%; font-size: 18px; color: #FFF; float: left; margin-left: 6%; text-decoration:none; } .rotate { -webkit-transition-duration: 0.8s; -moz-transition-duration: 0.8s; -o-transition-duration: 0.8s; transition-duration: 0.8s; -webkit-transition-property: -webkit-transform; -moz-transition-property: -moz-transform; -o-transition-property: -o-transform; transition-property: transform; overflow:hidden; } .rotate:hover { -webkit-transform:rotate(360deg); -moz-transform:rotate(360deg); -o-transform:rotate(360deg); } .info { width: 100%; height: 100px; line-height: 200%; margin: 20px 0 0 20px; } hr { color: #009ACD; } [/code]

Any feedback and harshly unnecessary criticism would be great!
